title: The Port Of Badon
opening: After speaking with the Ostian spy Leila, Eliwood realizes he must travel to Valor, the Dread Isle. The small island, located south of Lyica, is said to be home to the Dragon's Gate. Heading for the southern coast of Caelin, they seek passage in the port of Badon.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Listen! We need a boat to Valor!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: You want a boat to the Dread Isle? You're mad! No way! Never! There's no one in this village who'll sail there!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Please, we're in a hurry. Can you give us passage?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: If you won't help us, can you take us to someone who will? Please.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: You must be on urgent business, that's certain. ......There may be one way...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: What is it? Tell us, please!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Pirates.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Eh? Pirates?

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Uh-huh. They're fearless, or as close as makes no difference, and they'll go anywhere for a fee. Who knows? They might decide to accept your mad offer.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Pirates... Looks like we've no choice.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Are you serious, Hector? Working with pirates? That's unbelievable! You're considering it, aren't you, Eliwood?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: If there's no other way, what else can we do?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You, too, Eliwood? I've misjudged you... It's foolishness to trust the goodwill of pirates! I'm finding another way! (Lyn leaves)

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Why is she so angry?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I heard that Lyndis's parents were slain by bandits. Bandits at land, pirates at sea... They're all the same to Lyndis. Lawbreakers and murderers.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I see... My parents died of illness... But I can appreciate her feelings. Shall we abandon the pirate plan?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Too bad about the girl, but there's no other way.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Let's meet the pirates. We can't decide until then.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: That's true.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: That inn over there is a known favorite of the local freebooters. They're reckless and unpredictable. Best be prepared.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: What do you want, whelps? You're here to see me, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: You're commander of the pirate armada, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Gwah hah hah! "Commander of the pirate armada!" I like the sound of that! Are you lads that naive? Or are you just dumb? Which is it?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You insolent...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Peace, Hector!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: If I've insulted you, I apologize. How should I address you?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Hmph... You don't frighten easily, do you? Well, at least it seems you're not stupid. "Captain" will do, whelp. I'm Fargus, captain of the Davros.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Fargus... Master Fargus? Or should I call you Captain?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: You're not one of my mates. Call me Fargus. Now, what do you want?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We want to book passage to Valor.

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: How much will you pay?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We don't know the current rates. Tell us how much you want.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Wait, 100,000 gold?

intro.speaker: Fargus
intro.line: Well? Will you pay?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We've no choice, but we need a little time. We'll get the gold and return as quickly as possible. Come, Hector.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Wa-Wait a moment! Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood! Hold on! Where do you think you're going to get 100,000 gold?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I'm sure there's an arena here. We can raise gold somehow...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What? You're not serious!?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We've no other way, do we?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Well, no. (Steps back) Sometimes you surprise me, Eliwood.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Did you say something, Hector?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: No, nothing. Let's go earn some gold!

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: (Appears) Ahoy! Hold your ground, boys!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What now? We don't have the money yet.

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Fool! Of course you don't! I know that. The captain's got a message for you.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: A message?

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: All of my mates in this village are going to attack you. If you can beat us all and get to the ship unharmed, he'll give you passage.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: For free? No gold?

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: The captain's a tad off-kilter. He'd rather have a bit o' fun with you than take your gold. Smooth sailing to you.

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Hey! Landlubbers! Over here! I'm over here!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oh, for... This is a joke, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Looks serious enough. Here we go!

intro.speaker: Dart
intro.line: Listen! The captain's waiting at the docks. Talk to him and you're the winner! Trust me, though.... Don't make the mistake of attacking him! You anger the captain, and there's no turning back! Don't forget!!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: (Comes out of a nearby house) I couldn't find a ship after all. But we have to get to that island... Looks like I'll have to endure pirates. Hm? What was that? Commotion in the village?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Oh! Lyn! Nice timing. We need your help!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You're battling the pirates?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Fighting and... Look, we have to reach the docks and speak to the captain! This is a test to see whether or not he'll give us passage.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I don't understand, but.... I'm here, so let me help!

battle.speaker: Fargus
battle.line: What mooncalves! I would’ve let ’em sit there if they hadn’t come any closer. Up and at ’em, mates! Attack!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Are you interested in this sword here? It’s called a lancereaver. It’s an incredible sword to take against lances. Still, it is a little weak against axes. Go ahead, take it. You’re going to the Dread Isle, right? If you want to avoid the pirates, go behind the shop. From there, just head straight down the alley. Good luck to you.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: You’re a brave soul to come to such a perilous place. Here. You should have this staff. You can use it to make those whose magical resistances are weaker than your own fall asleep for a while. Whether it works or not depends on the skill of the wielder. Ho, yes. Looks like those pirates are bearing down on you. Maybe this staff will help you get away.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: This road leads to danger. The pirates are waiting for you. Do you not think it would be better to find another route? You’ve risked much to come here. I can’t let you leave empty-handed. Take this axe. What do you think? Nice, isn’t it? However...it’s cursed. It’s a mighty weapon, but if one with bad luck wields it... Ooooh! Terrible, terrible, I tell you. Don’t use it unless you have to.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: You’re being tested by pirates, with passage to the Dread Isle hanging in the balance? Here, use this bow. It’s a rare beauty, eh? A Sacaen friend gave it to me, but I can’t use it. Don’t get yourself killed out there, OK?

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Have you been to the arena yet? It’s filled with toughs and bravados. You can get rich there... All you have to do is wager and win. If you’re beaten, however, you lose both money and life. If you think you’re going to lose, press the B Button to give up. Remember, you can’t give up if you’re dead, so don’t wait too long.

boss.speaker: Damian
boss.line: You’re about to die. Scream if you must.

boss.speaker: Fargus
boss.line: Hey, there! What are you on about? Do you think to test me? Gwa ha ha ha ha ha! You’re a daft lot. I respect your courage, but you’ve chosen the wrong foe. If you can’t judge your enemy’s skill, you’ll wind up fish food. You’ll do well to remember that if you’re lucky enough to live.

boss.speaker: Fargus
boss.line: Uugwoh... Can’t believe... you...beat... me... You’ve...lost... your way... to...the Dread...Isle... for good...

boss.speaker: Fargus
boss.line: What’s this? Are you spent already? Hm? Attacking someone you’re asking a favor of? Insolent louts! I thought you smarter than that. You disappointed me. Go on! Away with you!! There’s no ship that’ll carry such conceited half-wits as you!! Never show your faces here again!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Haa...haa...You'll give us passage now, won't you?

end.speaker: Fargus
end.line: I'm a man of the sea. I always keep my word.Are my old eyes lyin' to me? Is this beauty really with you? Gwaa ha ha ha!! My lucky day!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Listen, I know how you feel, but you have to accept it. We've no other choice!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I know that! I haven't said a word, have I?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: We can go to the Dread Isle now. Please, Father... be well.
